unnormalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood Overload! Will Our Wallets Survive?**
normalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood Overload! Will Our Wallets Survive?**

unnormalised: Brace yourselves, folks! Bollywood's release calendar is looking more packed than a Mumbai local during rush hour. This Diwali, we're not just lighting diyas, we're lighting up the box office with at least 4 major releases battling for your attention... and your hard-earned Rs. 500 notes.
normalised: Brace yourselves, folks! Bollywood's release calendar is looking more packed than a Mumbai local during rush hour. This Diwali, we're not just lighting diyas, we're lighting up the box office with at least four major releases battling for your attention... and your hard earned rupee five hundred notes.

unnormalised: Rumor has it, Karan Johar's latest magnum opus, "Prem Ki Biryani," starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor, is expected to be a three-hour-long emotional rollercoaster, complete with 17 dance numbers and enough melodrama to fuel a daily soap for a year.
normalised: Rumor has it, Karan Johar's latest magnum opus, "Prem Ki Biryani," starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor, is expected to be a three hour long emotional rollercoaster, complete with seventeen dance numbers and enough melodrama to fuel a daily soap for a year.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, action king Rohit Shetty is back with "Singham Returns Again," promising even more car explosions than the last five installments combined. We're estimating at least 50 cars will meet their fiery demise within the first 15 minutes. Good for Maruti Suzuki, bad for the environment.
normalised: Meanwhile, action king Rohit Shetty is back with "Singham Returns Again," promising even more car explosions than the last five installments combined. We're estimating at least fifty cars will meet their fiery demise within the first fifteen minutes. Good for Maruti Suzuki, bad for the environment.

unnormalised: And don't forget the smaller, but hopefully sweeter, indie flick "Masala Chai Chronicles," filmed entirely in a quaint village near Shimla. Word on the street is that the chai served during filming was exceptional.
normalised: And don't forget the smaller, but hopefully sweeter, indie flick "Masala Chai Chronicles," filmed entirely in a quaint village near Shimla. Word on the street is that the chai served during filming was exceptional.

unnormalised: With so many options, choosing which film to watch is harder than deciding what mithai to eat during Diwali. One thingâ€™s for sure, our wallets will be lighter than a feather after this festive season!
normalised: With so many options, choosing which film to watch is harder than deciding what mithai to eat during Diwali. One thing's for sure, our wallets will be lighter than a feather after this festive season!
